original_text:
Book of Ra 6
Come è facile intuire dal titolo della slot machine, Book of Ra 6 è uno dei giochi che fanno parte della fortunata e omonima saga della Novomatic. Anche in questo caso ci troviamo di fronte a un titolo che sfrutta come tematica quella dell’antico Egitto, un tema molto comune non solo nella scuderia Novomatic, ma in generale tra le slot online.
In questa recensione dedicata andremo a dare un’occhiata sia al comparto visivo offerto da questo titolo, sia alle sue meccaniche di gioco.

Cosa vedere in Book of Ra 6
Nell’aprire per la prima volta questa slot, ci troviamo all’interno di un tempio o una piramide. Lo stile è più crepuscolare e dettagliato rispetto al Book of Ra originale e anche i simboli delle carte da gioco (A, K, Q…) che un tempo risultavano essere fuori posto rispetto al tema della slot, ora sono stati adattati prendendo una forma simili ai geroglifici.
Ciò che rimane fuori posto, ma per fortuna il giocatore ha la possibilità di scelta se attivarli o meno, sono i suoni che rimangono gli stessi della slot originale. Book of Ra offre quindi un passo in avanti da un punto di vista grafico pur mantenendo alcuni aspetti che l’hanno reso celebre (lo stesso, come vedremo a breve, accade nelle meccaniche di gioco).

Come giocare a Book of Ra 6
Passiamo all’aspetto tecnico di questo gioco. Innanzitutto troviamo una novità nella stessa griglia, in quanto al posto del classico schema 5*3 troviamo un insolito 6*3. La maggior parte delle slot che vogliono ampliare la propria griglia optano per una linea orizzontale aggiuntiva, ottenendo un 5*4, ma Book of Ra 6 si è mossa in un’altra direzione.
In realtà, il sesto rullo rappresenta un extra che può essere attivato o disattivato in base allo stile di gioco del giocatore. Attivare il rullo comporta la possibilità di ottenere delle vincite più grandi ma raddoppia anche il costo della puntata. Nel caso in cui, quindi, non volessimo correre questo rischio, è possibile disattivarlo e giocare con una slot 5*3 e 10 linee di vincita (la più classica tra quelle online).
La funzione di betting/rischio molto apprezzata nel titolo originale viene proposta anche in Book of Ra 6, dove sarà possibile partecipare a un gioco di raddoppia o perdi a seguito di ogni vincita, in cui dovremo indovinare il colore della carta nascosta.
Anche in questo caso è il Book of Ra, ovvero il simbolo del libro, a ricoprire sia il ruolo di Wild (un jolly in grado di sostituire tutti gli altri simboli) che di Scatter (trovandone almeno 3 è possibile accedere ai giri gratuiti).
Una slot quindi che consolida le funzioni che hanno reso celebre questa saga portando però delle novità sia nel comparto grafico che meccanico.

Slot simili a Book of Ra 6
Parlando di slot che abbiano elementi in comune con questo titolo, prima di spostarci verso altre case di sviluppo è bene ricordare gli altri giochi della stessa “saga” della Novomatic: Book of Ra, Book of Ra Deluxe e Book of Ra Magic.
Se invece siamo alla ricerca di altri titoli che offrano sei rulli al posto dei classici cinque, la nostra scelta si fa più limitata ma comunque interessante: da Germinator della Microgaming a Red Flag Fleet della WMS, a tema piratesco.

Sì e questo è uno dei tanti vantaggi offerti dalle slot online, ossia poter usufruire di promozioni e giri gratuiti senza dover depositare del denaro. raw_translation.response:
Book of Ra 6
As the title suggests, Book of Ra 6 is one of the games belonging to the successful and eponymous Novomatic saga. Once again, we are faced with a theme based on ancient Egypt, a very popular theme not only among Novomatic games but in general among online slots.
In this dedicated review, we will take a look at both the visual aspect offered by this title and its gameplay mechanics.

What to expect from Book of Ra 6
Opening this slot for the first time, we find ourselves inside a temple or pyramid. The style is more twilight and detailed compared to the original Book of Ra, and even the symbols of the playing cards (A, K, Q...), which once seemed out of place compared to the slot's theme, have now been adapted to take on a form similar to hieroglyphics.
What remains out of place, but fortunately, the player has the option to activate or not, are the sounds that remain the same as the original slot. Book of Ra offers a step forward from a visual perspective while still maintaining some aspects that made it famous (the same, as we will see shortly, happens in the game mechanics).

How to play Book of Ra 6
Let's move on to the technical aspect of this game. Firstly, we find a novelty in the grid itself, as instead of the classic 5*3 grid, we find an unusual 6*3. Most slots that want to expand their grid opt for an additional horizontal line, obtaining a 5*4, but Book of Ra 6 has moved in another direction.
In reality, the sixth reel represents an extra that can be activated or deactivated based on the player's gaming style. Activating the reel means the possibility of getting bigger wins but also doubling the cost of the bet. In case we do not want to take this risk, it is possible to deactivate it and play with a 5*3 slot and 10 paylines (the most classic among online slots).
The popular betting/gamble function included in the original title is also offered in Book of Ra 6, where it is possible to participate in a game of doubling or losing after each win, where we have to guess the colour of the hidden card.
Once again, the Book of Ra symbol, representing both the Wild (a wildcard that can replace all other symbols) and the Scatter (finding at least 3 can access free spins), plays a crucial role.
A slot, therefore, that consolidates the functions that have made this saga famous while bringing innovations in both the graphics and gameplay.

Similar slots to Book of Ra 6
Speaking of slots that have elements in common with this title, before moving on to other development houses, it is worth remembering the other games of the same Novomatic "saga": Book of Ra, Book of Ra Deluxe and Book of Ra Magic.
If instead, we are looking for other titles that offer six reels instead of the classic five, our choice is more limited but still interesting: from Microgaming's Germinator to WMS's Red Flag Fleet, with a pirate theme.

Book of Ra 6
As the name suggests, Book of Ra 6 is one of the popular titles of the Novomatic series of slot games. Once again, we encounter the theme of ancient Egypt, a very common theme not only in the Novomatic stable, but in general among online slots. In this review, we'll take a look at both the visual aspect and gameplay mechanics offered by this title.

What to expect from Book of Ra 6
In launching this slot for the first time, we find ourselves in a temple or pyramid. The style is more detailed and twilight than the original Book of Ra, and even the playing card symbols (A, K, Q, etc.) that used to be out of place with the slot's theme have now been adapted to look like hieroglyphics. What remains out of place, but fortunately the player has the option to choose whether to activate them or not, are the sounds that remain consistent with the original slot. Nevertheless, Book of Ra represents a step forward in graphical terms, while still retaining some of its iconic features (as we will see shortly, this also applies to gameplay mechanics).

How to play Book of Ra 6
Let's move on to the technical aspect of the game. Firstly, we find a novelty in the grid itself, where instead of the classic 5x3 layout, we find an unusual 6x3 layout. Most slots that want to expand their grid opt for an additional horizontal line, resulting in a 5x4 layout, but Book of Ra 6 has gone in another direction. In fact, the sixth reel represents an extra feature that can be activated or deactivated depending on the player's play style. Activating the reel provides the opportunity to get bigger wins but also doubles the cost of the bet. If we don't want to take this risk, we can deactivate it and play with a 5x3 slot and 10 pay lines (the most classic among online slots). 

The risk/betting function that was much appreciated in the original title is also available in Book of Ra 6, where it's possible to participate in a double or lose game following each win, where we have to guess the color of the hidden card. Once again, the Book of Ra symbol assumes both the role of Wild (a wildcard that can replace all other symbols) and Scatter (finding at least 3 allows you to access free spins). It's a slot game that consolidates the features that have made this saga famous, but also brings new features to both the graphical and mechanical sides of the game.

Review:
 
Gameplay and Features

Book of Ra 6 is a visually appealing online slot game by Novomatic that features 6 reels and 10 paylines. The game includes the popular betting/gamble function and the Book of Ra symbol, representing both the Wild and the Scatter. This game combines the functions that made the original Book of Ra famous while bringing in innovations in the graphics and gameplay.

The Book of Ra symbol is the Wild and Scatter symbol in Book of Ra 6. As a Wild, it acts as a wildcard that can replace all other symbols. As a Scatter, finding at least three of them activates free spins.

Gamble Function

The popular betting/gamble function from the original Book of Ra is included in Book of Ra 6. Review: Book of Ra 6
As the title suggests, Book of Ra 6 is one of the games belonging to the successful and eponymous Novomatic saga. Once again, we are faced with a theme based on ancient Egypt, a very popular theme not only among Novomatic games but in general among online slots.
In this dedicated review, we will take a look at both the visual aspect offered by this title and its gameplay mechanics.

What to expect from Book of Ra 6
Opening this slot for the first time, we find ourselves inside a temple or pyramid. The style is more twilight and detailed compared to the original Book of Ra, and even the symbols of the playing cards (A, K, Q...), which once seemed out of place compared to the slot's theme, have now been adapted to take on a form similar to hieroglyphics.
What remains out of place, but fortunately, the player has the option to activate or not, are the sounds that remain the same as the original slot. Book of Ra offers a step forward from a visual perspective while still maintaining some aspects that made it famous (the same, as we will see shortly, happens in the game mechanics).

How to play Book of Ra 6
Let's move on to the technical aspect of this game. Firstly, we find a novelty in the grid itself, as instead of the classic 5*3 grid, we find an unusual 6*3. Most slots that want to expand their grid opt for an additional horizontal line, obtaining a 5*4, but Book of Ra 6 has moved in another direction.
In reality, the sixth reel represents an extra that can be activated or deactivated based on the player's gaming style. Activating the reel means the possibility of getting bigger wins but also doubling the cost of the bet. In case we do not want to take this risk, it is possible to deactivate it and play with a 5*3 slot and 10 paylines (the most classic among online slots).
The popular betting/gamble function included in the original title is also offered in Book of Ra 6, where it is possible to participate in a game of doubling or losing after each win, where we have to guess the colour of the hidden card.
Once again, the Book of Ra symbol, representing both the Wild (a wildcard that can replace all other symbols) and the Scatter (finding at least 3 can access free spins), plays a crucial role.
A slot, therefore, that consolidates the functions that have made this saga famous while bringing innovations in both the graphics and gameplay.

Similar slots to Book of Ra 6
Speaking of slots that have elements in common with this title, before moving on to other development houses, it is worth remembering the other games of the same Novomatic "saga": Book of Ra, Book of Ra Deluxe and Book of Ra Magic.
If instead, we are looking for other titles that offer six reels instead of the classic five, our choice is more limited but still interesting: from Microgaming's Germinator to WMS's Red Flag Fleet, with a pirate theme.
